decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | A detailed energy strategy shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of development.  The strategy shall demonstrate that the scheme reduces carbon dioxide emissions for the buildings by the minimum requirements of the building regulations, plus the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations by at least 10% and then incorporate renewable energy technologies to achieve a carbon dioxide emissions reduction of at least 10% for the development. The approved strategy shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements in accordance with policies 2.9 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The details (samples/detailed drawings/manufacturers specification information) of materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that the development achieves a quality external appearance and is environmentally sound and compatible with surrounding development/land uses, in accordance with policies 2.1 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information submitted, details of hard and soft landscape works, for all open areas not covered by buildings or roads and incorporating and including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the local planning authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season. Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area. In accordance with policy 4.5 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | Details of the arrangements to ensure the continued maintenance of all hard and soft landscaped areas shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall in place prior to occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is properly maintained to provide a satisfactory screen and setting for the development, in accordance with policies 3.2, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). Maintenance of all hard and soft landscaped areas | Details of the scheme for the disposal of surface water and sewage shall be submitted and approved in writing and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be in place and fully operational, prior to the occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure the proposed drainage of the development is in accordance with the required standards and that the development does not pollute the water environment, or give rise to an increase risk of flooding, nor to an overloading of the sewage system in the locality, in accordance with policies 2.1 & 4.1.the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). Details of the scheme for the disposal of surface water and sewage | Details of the means of boundary enclosure of the site and within the site facilities shall be submitted to, and approved by the local planning authority before development commences and the approved details shall be completed prior to the first occupation of any part of the development.  Reason: To ensure that the development achieves a quality external appearance and is environmentally sound and compatible with surrounding development/land uses, in accordance with policies 2.1 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted for approval to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of any contamination found, and for the remedial works to be implemented before any other works commence. Any scheme for mitigation which may be approved shall be carried out as approved before the development is carried out. Reason: In the interests of ensuring a safe environment in accordance with policy 2.7 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The 40 car parking spaces, including 6 disabled spaces shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the residential units, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, loading and drop off within the site, in accordance with policies 4.3, 9.1 and 9.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 (Accessible Ealing). | The cycle parking provision (40) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first use of the development hereby approved, and retained permanently, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the proposed access to the proposed basement car park, the access ramp in terms of its width, gradient and geometry, shall be submitted to, and approved by the, local planning authority before development commences.  Reason: In the interest of highway safety and general amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21 'Travel Plans' | Details of the pedestrian visibility splay at the entrance to the site shall be submitted to, and approve by, the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The works involved in the approved details shall be implemented before any unit is occupied.  Reason: In the interest of highway safety and general amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21 'Travel Plans' | Prior to the commencement of development a detailed Green Travel Plan detailing a strategy to encourage residents and visitors to use alternative means of travel to cars, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Once approved, the Green Travel Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the details submitted.  Reason: In the interest of highway safety and general amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21 'Travel Plans' | Details of refuse and recycling storage and/or a management plan, in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be installed/implemented prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure refuse collection arrangements are provided in order to ensure pedestrian and highway safety and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - (Refuse and Recycling Facilities). | Details of sound attenuation measures from traffic and aircraft noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential unit and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 - Noise and Vibration. | The development hereby approved shall be fully accessible for people with disabilities.Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3, 5.5 and 8.8 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Any ventilation system provided within the development shall be silenced to a standard not exceeding NR 35 Leq, 5min (2300 - 0700hrs), measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises.Reason: To safeguard the living and working conditions of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 (Noise and Vibration) | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise by at least 5 dBA at 3.5m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1 m from the nearest first floor or higher.Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of neighbours, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 11: Noise and Vibration. | Before development commences, details of sound attenuation measures from traffic noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential unit and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 - Noise and Vibration. | Prior to the commencement of the development a `Construction Strategy` shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The means of site management and construction shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Strategy, which should also include details of the means of access for construction works and details of noise, vibration and dust mitigation measures during the redevelopment.Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The 26 units of affordable accommodation hereby approved shall be permanently retained on site and shall not be used for any other purpose, including private tenure, without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that an acceptable amount of affordable housing is maintained within the development; in accordance with policy 5.2 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The residential development shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards and include 10% constructed to Wheelchair Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the all new units are accessible to people with disabilities, in accordance with policy 5.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004;and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: Accessible Ealing. | Any fixtures, furniture, landscaping, plants and other similar features proposed to be installed on the communal roof top garden areas and private balconies must be permanently secured. No hanging of washing shall occur on any of the balconies.Reason: In the interests of the visual amenity of the area and community safety in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the works necessary to protect the trees to be retained within and adjacent to the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be inplemented prior to commencement of the development and retained until it is completed.  No materials, plant, other equipment, storage or other works shall take place at any time within the enclosed area around the trees to be retained.   REASON: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.
description: Redevelopment of Acton Central Industrial Estate to include the demolition of the existing commercial buildings: erection of a part 5 and 6 storey building with basement level for parking to contain a mixture of 59 new private and affordable residential units; hard and soft landscaping incorporating the creation of new open spaces, tree planting and children+s playspace; provision of energy efficient and renewable energy technology; provision of 40 on-site vehicular parking spaces at basement level and cycle parking, with vehicular access retained from Rosemont Road
